etymology.description: 又(又) (yòu, "hand") + 中(中) (zhōng, "a flagpole with a drum") = flag in hand -> to perform one's job
etymology.interpretation: The character 事(事) (shì, "matter") represents the concept of handling or managing affairs, symbolized by holding a flag, indicating a formal duty or role. The flagpole with a drum suggests organized activity or official matters.

examples.chinese: 这件事很复杂(這件事很複雜)。
小事也能引发大问题(小事也能引發大問題)，我们需要认真对待(我們需要認真對待)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo shì yě néng yǐn fā dà wèntí, wǒmen xūyào rènzhēn duìdài.
examples.english: Even small matters can trigger big problems; we need to handle them seriously.

examples.chinese: 他总是处理各种事(他總是處理各種事)，不管大小(不管大小)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒng shì chǔlǐ gèzhǒng shì, bùguǎn dàxiǎo.
examples.english: He always manages various affairs, regardless of their significance.
